Light Detection main¶

Command line tool to find lights in an image

Detect the lights in an image.

Parse the arguments.

Returns:

argparse.Namespace: The command line arguments.

Light Detection detectors¶

Contains object detection classes.

class light_detect.detectors.LightDetector(image_path=None, image=None, blur_length=5, threshold=210)[source]¶

Object capable of finding light sources in an image.

property gaussian_blur_length¶

int: The edge length of the gaussion blur kernel.

property light_centers¶

list(tuple(int, int)): Contains the center of each light.

property light_circles¶

Decorate the property method with the ability to automatically set the corresponding instance variable of the class.

property light_contours¶

Decorate the property method with the ability to automatically set the corresponding instance variable of the class.

show_lights(colour=0, 0, 255, thickness=3)[source]¶

Display the lights.

Keyword Args:
colour (tuple(uint8)):

The BGR colour to mark the lights with.

thickness (int):

The line thickness to use in marking the lights.

property threshold¶

np.uint8: The value to threshold the image on.

Light Detection utils¶

Utility Functions.

light_detect.utils.autoset_property(property_method)[source]¶

Wraps a class property to automatically set the corresponding instance variable if it evaluates False. This requires the instance variable name be an underscore followed by the property method name, and a corresponding setter method be implemented and named _set followed by the instance variable name. This allows automatic caching of potentially slow to set variables.

Args:
property_method (method):

The class property that is to be decorated.
